com.simsilica.es.server

Class EntityDataHostService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simsilica.es.server.EntityDataHostService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityHostSettings

    public class EntityDataHostService
extends java.lang.Object
implements EntityHostSettings
    Provides server-side hosting capability for an EntityData instance. Once attached to a server, this will process messages and make sure client requests are granted and client updates are sent.

    It is up to the game server to periodically call sendUpdates() to flush any pending EntitySet changes to clients.

    For JME 3.1 and above, use EntityDataHostedService and EntityDataClientService instead of these more crude classes. They will be deprecated when JME 3.1 is full released.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityDataHostService

        public EntityDataHostService(com.jme3.network.Server server,
                             int channel,
                             com.simsilica.es.ObservableEntityData ed)
        Creates a new EntityDataHostService that will watch for new connections on the specified Server and provide access to the specified EntityData. Entity request and response messages will be sent on the specified channel.

        public void sendUpdates()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Causes this service to stop listening for new connections and all existing connections will have stopHostingOnConnection() called for them.

      • startHostingOnConnection

        public void startHostingOnConnection(com.jme3.network.HostedConnection hc)
        Sets up the specified connection for hosting remote entity data commands. By default this is performed automatically in addConnection() and is controlled by the setAutoHost() property.

      • stopHostingOnConnection

        public void stopHostingOnConnection(com.jme3.network.HostedConnection hc)
        Terminates the specified connection for hosting remote entity data commands. By default this is performed automatically in removeConnection().

      • setMaxEntityBatchSize

        public void setMaxEntityBatchSize(int i)
        Sets the maximum number of entities that will be sent back in a single batched results message. The optimal number largely depends on the relative size of an average entity as the app retrieves it. Small components and small numbers of components per entity means larger batches are optimal. Defaults to 20.

      • getMaxEntityBatchSize

        public int getMaxEntityBatchSize()
        Specified by:
        getMaxEntityBatchSize in interface EntityHostSettings

      • setMaxChangeBatchSize

        public void setMaxChangeBatchSize(int i)
        Sets the maximum number of EntityChanges that will be sent back in a single batched results message. The optimal number largely depends on the average size of components. Defaults to 20.

      • getMaxChangeBatchSize

        public int getMaxChangeBatchSize()
        Specified by:
        getMaxChangeBatchSize in interface EntityHostSettings

      • setAutoHost

        public void setAutoHost(boolean b)
        Set to true to have new connections automatically 'hosted' by this entity service. In other words, any newly added connections will automatically have startHostingOnConnection() called. Set this to false if the application requires further client setup before letting them access entities. In that case, the game server will have to call startHostingOnConnection() manually. Defaults to true.

      • getAutoHost

        public boolean getAutoHost()
